results.title: Les Sesterain Ou le Miroir 2000: Episode 5
results.brief_description:
Antoine tries to talk sense into Lauzon but he remains inflexible and convices the members of the Landowners’ Union to refuse the offer made by the expropriation authority. As a result the break up between the men is inevitable and Francois and Maritine’s wedding is reported. Henri, the eldest of the Sesterain and the station’s project manager is asked to mediate.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Francois Villiers ; writers, Andre Maheux, Francois Villiers ; photography, Paul Soulignac, Henri Raichi ; music, Francois de Roubaix.
Cast: Etienne Bierry, Jean-Claude Dauphin, Marie-Christine Barrault, Georges Claisse, Yves Lefebvre, Christian Alers, Marthe Villalonga, Marie-Helene Breillat.

results.title: Les Sesterain Ou le Miroir 2000: Episode 4
results.brief_description:
Pierre has, against all expectations, graduated from high school. Back at the village, he is offred to travel to Paris with Flandin, the local taxi driver, to help pick up a brand new ambulance. The party plans to stay at Flandin’s brother’s. Pierre becomes smitten with Marie, Flandin’s niece and invites her to spend the summer holidyas at Le Miroir.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Francois Villiers ; writers, Andre Maheux, Francois Villiers ; photography, Paul Soulignac, Henri Raichi ; music, Francois de Roubaix.
Cast: Etienne Bierry, Jean-Claude Dauphin, Marie-Christine Barrault, Georges Claisse, Yves Lefebvre, Christian Alers, Marthe Villalonga, Marie-Helene Breillat.

results.title: Les Sesterain Ou le Miroir 2000: Episode 3
results.brief_description:
The Council is starting to discuss land appropiation and one councillor is expressing his determination not to give up his land. Everybody is starting to realise that the soul of the village is about to be irretrievably destroyed. During the engagement ceremony of Francois and Martine (Lauzon’s daughter), Aunt Agathe dies. Lauzon who now stands to inherit large plots of land earmarked for appropriation becomes one of the staunches opponents to the resort.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Francois Villiers ; writers, Andre Maheux, Francois Villiers ; photography, Paul Soulignac, Henri Raichi ; music, Francois de Roubaix.
Cast: Etienne Bierry, Jean-Claude Dauphin, Marie-Christine Barrault, Georges Claisse, Yves Lefebvre, Christian Alers, Marthe Villalonga.

results.title: Les Sesterain Ou le Miroir 2000: Episode 2
results.brief_description:
Pierre quits the college before the graduation exam and goes back to Le Miroir. Meanwhile, Martine announces to Francois that the engagement is off. Antoine pushes the development plan through the Council. His arguement that a resort might help save the village by giving young people a reason to stay at Le Miroir is rebutted by those who risk losing their farming land to building and development.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Francois Villiers ; writers, Andre Maheux, Francois Villiers ; photography, Paul Soulignac, Henri Raichi ; music, Francois de Roubaix.
Cast: Etienne Bierry, Jean-Claude Dauphin, Marie-Christine Barrault, Georges Claisse, Yves Lefebvre, Christian Alers, Marthe Villalonga.

results.title: Les Sesterain Ou le Miroir 2000: Episode 13
results.brief_description:
The first section of Le Miroir 2000 is inaugurated as Pierre and Marie’s wedding is celebrated. The Flandin family is also in high spirit as Robert integrated the French National Team.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Francois Villiers ; writers, Andre Maheux, Francois Villiers ; photography, Paul Soulignac, Henri Raichi ; music, Francois de Roubaix.
Cast: Etienne Bierry, Jean-Claude Dauphin, Marie-Christine Barrault, Georges Claisse, Yves Lefebvre, Christian Alers, Marthe Villalonga, Marie-Helene Breillat.

results.title: Les Sesterain Ou le Miroir 2000: Episode 12
results.brief_description:
Antoine tenders his resignation from the Council under what he perceives the pressure from the villagers. Pierre and Antoine negotiate the truce, until the news arrives from Paris that Marie is pregnant.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Francois Villiers ; writers, Andre Maheux, Francois Villiers ; photography, Paul Soulignac, Henri Raichi ; music, Francois de Roubaix.
Cast: Etienne Bierry, Jean-Claude Dauphin, Marie-Christine Barrault, Georges Claisse, Yves Lefebvre, Christian Alers, Marthe Villalonga, Marie-Helene Breillat.

results.title: Les Sesterain Ou le Miroir 2000: Episode 11
results.brief_description:
Pierre and Marie runaway and attempt to cross the border to Italy. At the village Council, some realise that the new development of Le Miroir 2000 may not benefit their small businesses after all.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Francois Villiers ; writers, Andre Maheux, Francois Villiers ; photography, Paul Soulignac, Henri Raichi ; music, Francois de Roubaix.
Cast: Etienne Bierry, Jean-Claude Dauphin, Marie-Christine Barrault, Georges Claisse, Yves Lefebvre, Christian Alers, Marthe Villalonga, Marie-Helene Breillat.

results.title: Les Sesterain Ou le Miroir 2000: Episode 10
results.brief_description:
Following Francois’ death, Martine leaves Le Miroir for Paris. Lauzon is feeling the reprobation of all the village and is more and more isolated. When Pierre and Marie announce their intention to get married, Antoine disapproves strongly.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Francois Villiers ; writers, Andre Maheux, Francois Villiers ; photography, Paul Soulignac, Henri Raichi ; music, Francois de Roubaix.
Cast: Etienne Bierry, Jean-Claude Dauphin, Marie-Christine Barrault, Georges Claisse, Yves Lefebvre, Christian Alers, Marthe Villalonga, Marie-Helene Breillat.

results.title: Les Sesterain Ou le Miroir 2000: Episode 1
results.brief_description:
The series follows two years in the life of village of Le Miroir and its residents as they go through the transformation of their quiet Alpine village into a modern skiing resort, Le Miroir 2000. The main protagonist is Antoine Sesterain, the mayor of the village and farmer. Antoine is a widower with three sons, all deeply attached to the mountains: Henri, a resort manager, Francois, a skiing instructor engaged to Martine and Pierre, a restless student. Pierre is causing havoc at the boarding school he attends in the valley and where his uncle, Abbe Bonnevie teaches. Following a prank, Pierre is denied permission to leave the school to attend his brother Henri’s wedding. During the wedding, Lauzon, a local saw-mill owner approaches Antoine with the idea of turning Le Miroir into a skiing resort. Set in the mid-1960s, ‘Les Sesterain’ is a realistic rendition of the changes many mountain villages had to go through as France sought to exploit the ‘white gold’ and the rising interest in winter sports.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Francois Villiers ; writers, Andre Maheux, Francois Villiers ; photography, Paul Soulignac, Henri Raichi ; music, Francois de Roubaix.
Cast: Etienne Bierry, Jean-Claude Dauphin, Marie-Christine Barrault, Georges Claisse, Yves Lefebvre, Christian Alers, Marthe Villalonga.

results.title: Les Mysteres de Paris (TV Version) = the Mysteries of Paris
results.brief_description:
This version of Sue’s novel was originally conceived as a live-to-air production. Rodolphe de Sombreuil runs over a poor man in the streets and promises he will look after his young daughter. Sombreuil disguises himself as a working-class man and goes looking for Fleur de Marie who has been kidnapped by shady underworld characters. He is appalled by the squalor in which people live in the depressing working class slums.

Credits: Director, Marcel Cravenne ; writers, Claude Santelli ; photography, Maurice Barry ; music, Maurice Jarre.
Cast: Clotilde Joano, Marcel Bozzuffi, Jacques Dacqmine, Edmond Beauchamp, Georgette Anys, Jacques Marin, Francois Chaumette, Denise Gence, Veronique Silver, Maria Mauban, Claude Pieplu, Francois Maistre, Maria Meriko, Victor Lanoux, Clara Daquin.
